intro: Frailea albifusca, commonly known as the white-fleshed stonecress, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and pale green to white-colored stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Frailea albifusca is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
